string-array.item: A copy of the universe is not what is required of art; one of the damned things is ample. — Rebecca West
A critic is a bundle of biases held loosely together by a sense of taste. — Whitney Balliett
A fool-proof method for sculpting an elephant: first, get a huge block of marble; then you chip away everything that doesn\'t look like an elephant.
A man paints with his brains and not with his hands.
A poet who reads his verse in public may have other nasty habits.

string-array.item: The one charm of marriage is that it makes a life of deception a necessity. — Oscar Wilde
"Confound these ancestors.... They've stolen our best ideas!" — Ben Jonson
If you are not careful, you\'re going to catch something.

No one is fit to be trusted with power. … No one. ... Any man who has lived at all knows the follies and wickedness he\'s capable of. ... And if he does know it, he knows also that neither he nor any man ought to be allowed to decide a single human fate. — C. P. Snow, The Light and the Dark
